page.title: 03THE DISAPPEARING FARM
page.content:
At La Brecquette near L'Etacq, there was a farm in Medieval times, so legend goes. The farmhouse is assumed to have been a medieval manor farm but its very existence is still not proven. It is supposed to have been washed away in medieval times.
Poingdestre wrote in the 16th C. that there had been many storms and that the sea had washed away much land in several parts of the island.
Now there is nothing at that part of the bay where the farm was said to be except some shingle and boulders. Was there a farm there? Will the sea level fall again so that the land can be used for farming?
Who knows?
